## `summarise()`
Note: all the exercises of this section are based on the `flights` dataset.

```{r require, results='hide', message=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
library(nycflights13)
```


### Exercise 1
Calculate minimum, mean and maximum delay at arrival.

```{r ex1, echo=show_solution, eval=show_solution}
summarise(flights,
          min_delay = min(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
          max_delay = max(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
          mean_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE))
```


### Exercise 2
Calculate minimum, mean and maximum delay at arrival for flights in January.

```{r ex2, echo=show_solution, eval=show_solution}
flights_jan <- filter(flights, month == 1)
summarise(flights_jan,
          min_delay = min(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
          max_delay = max(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE),
          mean_delay = mean(arr_delay, na.rm = TRUE))
```


### Exercise 3
Calculate the number of flights and the number of carriers

```{r ex3, echo=show_solution, eval=show_solution}
summarise(flights, n = n(), n_carriers = n_distinct(carrier))
```
